comment: SOP-004 review complete. Document aligns with CR-009 Section 6 approved outline. All required sections present: Purpose, Scope, Definitions, Executable Block structure, Document States, Scope Integrity, Progress Tracking, Evidence Requirements, Exception Reports. Critical INV-001 lesson explicitly stated in Section 6.2: 'Different execution mechanism is NOT a scope exclusion.' Section 10 correctly references SOP-002 Section 7.3 post-review requirements. Terminology consistent with SOP-001 and SOP-002. Cross-references to SOP-001, SOP-002, and SOP-003 present. No procedural issues identified.

REVIEW FINDINGS - SOP-004 v1.1

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: 'Document Execution' - VERIFIED PRESENT
- revision_summary: 'CR-014: Add Pass/Fail outcomes, VAR framework, and updated closure requirements' - VERIFIED PRESENT, begins with CR ID

CHANGES VERIFIED:
- Section 4.2: New EI table format with Task Outcome column - VERIFIED
- Section 7: Execution Outcome Documentation - VERIFIED
- Section 8: Evidence Requirements for Pass/Fail - VERIFIED
- Section 9: ER scope limited to test documents - VERIFIED
- Section 9A: VAR framework with Type 1/Type 2 - VERIFIED
- Section 10: Post-Review Requirements updated - VERIFIED

DEFICIENCY 1 - INCONSISTENCY WITH SOP-001:
Section 3 Definition Table defines Executable Document as: 'A document that authorizes implementation activities (CR, INV, TP, ER)'
However, SOP-001-draft Section 3 defines Executable Document as: 'A document that authorizes implementation activities (CR, INV, CAPA, TP, ER, VAR)'
SOP-004 Section 3 is MISSING VAR from the executable document list, creating an inconsistency between the two SOPs being updated under the same CR.

DEFICIENCY 2 - SCOPE SECTION INCOMPLETE:
Section 2 (Scope) lists CR, INV, TP, ER but does NOT list VAR, yet Section 9A extensively documents VAR handling including workflow, content requirements, naming conventions, and scope handoff procedures.

REQUIRED CORRECTIONS:
1. Section 3: Add VAR to Executable Document definition to match SOP-001
2. Section 2: Add VAR to scope list since this SOP governs VAR execution

RECOMMENDATION: REQUEST UPDATES - Cross-reference inconsistencies between SOP-001 and SOP-004 must be corrected before approval.

Review complete. All previously identified deficiencies have been corrected: (1) Section 2 Scope now includes VAR in the list of executable documents, (2) Section 3 Definitions now includes VAR in the Executable Document definition. Frontmatter verified: title='Document Execution', revision_summary='CR-014: Add Pass/Fail outcomes, VAR framework, and updated closure requirements'. No placeholder content found. Document structure follows SOP template with consistent formatting. VAR framework is comprehensively documented with clear distinctions between VAR/ER/INV and Type 1/Type 2 VARs. Document is COMPLIANT and ready for approval.

Review of SOP-004-draft.md v2.1. FRONTMATTER: title='Document Execution' (present, non-empty); revision_summary='CR-016: Add Proposed Corrective Action to ER content requirements' (present, begins with CR ID). STRUCTURE: All 11 sections present (Purpose, Scope, Definitions, The Executable Block, Document States During Execution, Scope Integrity, Execution Outcome Documentation, Evidence Requirements, Exception Reports, Variance Reports, Post-Review Requirements, References). CR-016 CHANGES VERIFIED: Section 9.2 now includes 'Proposed Corrective Action' in ER content list between Root Cause and Exception Type. PLACEHOLDERS: None found. FORMATTING: Consistent. VERDICT: COMPLIANT. Recommend approval.

COMPLIANT. SOP-004 v3.1 reviewed for CR-082 changes. All declared modifications verified.

FRONTMATTER:
- title: "Document Execution" -- verified present, non-empty.
- revision_summary: "CR-082: Add ADD (Addendum) document type -- Section 2, 3 updated; new Section 9B" -- verified present, references CR-082 per SOP-002 Section 8.

CHANGE VERIFICATION (all PASS):
1. Section 2 (Scope): "Addendum Reports (ADD)" correctly added to executable document list after VAR.
2. Section 3 (Definitions): Executable Document definition updated from "(CR, INV, TP, ER, VAR)" to "(CR, INV, TP, ER, VAR, ADD)".
3. New Section 9B "Addendum Reports (ADD)" with five subsections:
   - 9B.1 (ADD vs VAR vs INV): Clear comparison table with Use Case, Timing, and Parent State columns. Key distinctions well-articulated.
   - 9B.2 (ADD Content): Seven required content items specified (Addendum Identification, Description of Omission, Impact Assessment, Correction Plan, Execution, Scope Handoff, Execution Summary).
   - 9B.3 (ADD Naming): Examples consistent with SOP-001 Section 6.1 naming convention, including nested case (CR-014-ADD-001-ADD-001).
   - 9B.4 (Parent State Requirement): CLOSED state constraint clearly stated. Valid parent types (CR, INV, VAR, ADD) specified with rationale for TP/ER exclusion.
   - 9B.5 (Scope Handoff): Three-item specification matching VAR pattern from 9A.5.

INTEGRITY CHECK: All sections outside declared scope (1, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 9A, 10, 11) are identical to effective v3.0. No unintended modifications.
CROSS-REFERENCE CHECK: SOP-001 Section 3 ADD definition references "SOP-004 Section 9B" -- this section now exists with substantive content. SOP-001 Section 6.1 naming convention matches Section 9B.3 examples.
PLACEHOLDER CHECK: No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found.
FORMATTING CHECK: Consistent throughout. Section numbering follows established pattern (9, 9A, 9B). Table alignment correct.
TYPO CHECK: None found.

Recommend for approval.

REVIEW: COMPLIANT. All criteria verified with evidence against CR-084 pre-approved scope.

FRONTMATTER:
- title: "Document Execution" -- present, non-empty, unchanged.
- revision_summary: "CR-084: Add integration verification note to Section 9A.3 for code-related VAR resolution" -- references CR-084 per SOP-002 Section 8.

CHANGES VERIFIED (per CR-084 Section 5.2):
- One paragraph appended to end of Section 9A.3 VAR Content bullet list -- confirmed.
- Advisory "should" language used ("resolution work should include integration verification") -- confirmed per CR-084 specification.
- Content accurately describes exercising fix through user-facing levers -- confirmed.

SCOPE BOUNDARY: Only Section 9A.3 was modified. Sections 1-9A.2 and 9A.4-11 are identical to effective v4.0.

No placeholder content, typos, or formatting issues found.

Review complete. COMPLIANT.

FRONTMATTER: title="Document Execution" (unchanged), revision_summary="CR-085: Add pre-execution repository commit requirement to Section 5" (correctly references CR-085 per SOP-002 Section 8).

CHANGE VERIFIED: New paragraph added at line 91, after the existing note in Section 5. Content: "Before releasing an executable document for execution (transitioning from PRE_APPROVED to IN_EXECUTION), the initiator shall commit and push the QMS repository. This preserves the pre-execution baseline -- the pre-approved document content, routing history, and approval records -- in version control before implementation work begins." Placement matches CR-085 Section 5.1 specification.

NO UNINTENDED CHANGES: All sections outside Section 5 are identical to the effective version (v5.0). Only the new paragraph was added.

PLACEHOLDER CHECK: No TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX found.
FORMATTING: Consistent throughout.
TYPOS/ERRORS: None found.

Recommend for approval.
